definitions.definition: To constrain someone by force or by social, moral or legal means.
definitions.example: I am obliged to report to the police station every week.

definitions.definition: To do (someone) a service or favour (hence, originally, creating an obligation).
definitions.example: He obliged me by not parking his car in the drive.
I am obliged to you for your recent help.

definitions.definition: Under an obligation to do something for someone.
Indebted because of a favor done.
